jobs.title: Sales Executive
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a full time technical Sales Executive to accelerate growth in our Digital Workplace offering. Reporting to our Sales Manager for Workplace, you’ll be proactively devising and executing lead-gen activities, tenacious in following up and nurturing opportunities, building relationships with senior-level to C-Level management, and be a product evangelist across Australia and New Zealand!

This would be the ideal next step from a pure phone based role. Ideally, you'll also have a passion for the web tech space, you’ll be a fast learner who is passionate about the Digital Workplace. Immediately personable, you’ll be able to establish and nurture strong relationships at all levels and most importantly not afraid to pick up the phone.

Ideally, you'll have:

* Min 2years experience in B2B new business sales and client relationship management would be ideal
* Thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment and able to adapt quickly
* Experience of consultative selling with confidence placing multiple phone calls, and attending meetings, presentations, and pitches
* Experience working with technical and/or digital products and solutions
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills, with strong listening and presentation skills
* Proven ability to multi-task, prioritise, and manage time effectively

Requirements

Some of what you'll do

* Generate high quality leads and develop relationships across Squiz’s new business target sectors; Higher Education, Utilities, Government, Media, Hospitality, Health and Finance
* Be accountable for nurturing leads from an early stage, and driving them to closure
* Build relationships and work collaboratively with existing sales teams across Australia and New Zealand
* Deliver high impact product demonstrations through a range of mediums
* Match customer needs with the value that our Digital Workplace solution offers



Benefits

Why work for Squiz?

* Wellness program - $300 per year to spend on your own well-being
* 30 days of paid leave/year
* Flexible working hours
* Generously stocked kitchen (and fridge!)
* Squiz Academy - includes professional sales coaching from industry experts
* Free membership to industry associations
* Access to local and international job opportunities across all our offices
* Agency environment - regular office drinks, social events, gaming nights, pool, ping pong and a large amount of chalk

We know that no candidate is perfect. Each person we meet can bend the definitions of a role based upon what they bring to the table. With that in mind, don’t let the bullet points scare you off - we encourage you to apply if you think Squiz is a fit for you. We’d love to meet you!

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.description:
We're looking for a confident PHP Developer, ready to increase their technical skills and further develop their career, within our talented, client facing development team.

Working closely with local and remote team mates you will build, and help architect, highly scalable and usable digital experience platform solutions. You’ll be expected to demonstrate initiative and creativity as part of a talented and multi-skilled team including designers, user researchers, consultants, and of-course other developers. Passionate about technology, you'll enjoy sharing that passion with both customers and colleagues alike.

The role

* Working as part of a team on Matrix CMS, Funnelback, Workplace, SugarCRM, Marketo, and Squiz Cloud implementations for enterprise clients – involving the design, build and testing of solutions
* Documenting your work on technical use cases which will be used later for our support team when troubleshooting your solution
* Performing unit testing, and peer reviews with other members of the team, to ensure the team only produces code of the highest standard

Requirements

About Squiz

The Squiz Digital Experience Platform is a suite of integrated, market leading products and tools to power your entire digital presence. Delivering amazing customer experiences with CMS, CRM, Marketing Automation, and Search and Innovation technology, we provide enterprise level solutions to the corporate, government, educational, not for profit and cultural sectors worldwide.

With over 450 employees in offices all over the globe, including the UK, Poland, USA, Australia and NZ, we work with the best people to bring systems, people and experiences together to deliver a consistent customer experience across multiple channels. Our goal is to empower our customers by providing the platform, tools and confidence needed to thrive in a digital first world.

Creative People. Clever Strategies. Brilliant Customer Experiences.

About you

With previous PHP and JavaScript experience, you'll be passionate about solving problems, and interested in learning everything there is to know about our digital experience platform. You’ll design quality solutions which are elegant, present fantastic user experience, and can scale massively upwards.

We’re looking for the following skills and experience…

Essential:

* Solid experience in a back end or full stack PHP Developer role
* Good knowledge of PHP 7 and MySQL
* Experience using Composer and knowledge of PSR-4
* Experience working with an ORM (e.g. Doctrine)
* Familiar with Elasticsearch or Apache Solr
* Experience writing front-end JavaScript and using NPM packages
* Familiar with CSS and Less
* Comfortable with Git, Linux command line, and integrating with REST APIs
* Experience of leading development on a commercial project
* Familiar with estimating development work for self and others
* Commercial experience working on an application processing and storing large quantities of data
* Proactive and self-driven, with strong interpersonal, time management and communication skills

Nice to have:

* Experience delivering SugarCRM projects
* Authoring or contribution to an open-source project
* Experience working in Waterfall and Agile methodologies
* Working in Scrum framework
* Experience writing PHPUnit unit tests
* Experience using Behat front-end tests
* Understanding of OAuth authentication flows
* Experience using JIRA for issue tracking

Benefits

We believe in growing talent and encourage our team to take on more responsibility to develop their career with us. We’re a friendly bunch, and enjoy the unique, relaxed and social environments in all our offices across the globe. We love what we do and we're confident you'll love it too...

* Flexible Working Hours
* 30 days annual leave + bank holidays
* Annual Season Ticket Loan
* Annual Health and Wellbeing allowance
* Cycle to Work Scheme
* Employee Referral Scheme
* Excellent career development opportunities
* Macbook
* Great WeWork office space at Old Street roundabout
* Friday office stand-up, travel opportunities to other office locations, friendly and social team environment


Please note that Squiz and Funnelback do not accept speculative CVs and will not be liable for any introduction fees, or otherwise, should we engage with any candidate speculatively submitted by an agency.

jobs.title: Technical Consultant
jobs.description:
About you

A technically minded, commercially aware Technical/CRM Consultant ready to extend your skills and experience within our talented New York team, at the forefront of Customer Insights.

Using a blend of technical ability and commercial awareness, you will form lasting client partnerships, working closely with our clients to implement CRM solutions in a wide range of industries and applications. You’ll feel right at home across all areas of digital transformation project delivery, from sales to support.


About the role

Reporting to the Technical Director, and working alongside a Project Manager, you will join the close-knit Squiz New York team as a Technical Consultant, and lead our ongoing SugarCRM projects onwards to success. Using your business analysis and strong conceptual thinking skills, clients will approach you with all kinds of business problems - problems that you will distill down to elegant CRM processes and / or features.

You will provide technical guidance for ongoing and upcoming SugarCRM projects and will be expected to gather requirements, solution design, build specification for a remote delivery team, quality assurance, and then the delivery of the solution to the client, addressing any client feedback and suggested refinements, as per a scope of work set by the Technical Director and Project manager.

You will also be expected to provide day to day support to our clients on both a software and infrastructure level, o/e/ logging into servers, inspecting logs, debugging network connectivity, to identify the crux of any support issues that you will then work with our Support and Infrastructure team to resolve.

You will not be stage shy. This role will require you to be heavily client facing - give presentations, run workshops, challenge ideas - helping you build your consultation skills to form long lasting and successful relationships with your clients and coworkers.


About us

At Squiz we are all about people. We prioritize work life balance, have a supportive leadership team and believe our most important asset is the people that make the business work. With over 450 employees in offices all over the globe, including the USA, UK, Poland, Australia and New Zealand, we work with the best people to bring systems, people and experiences together to deliver a consistent customer experience across multiple channels.

Through a combination of technology and services, our goal is to empower our customers by providing the platform, tools, and confidence needed to thrive in a digital first world. We're all about making great technology do even greater things.

Squiz delivers amazing customer experiences with our own software, Squiz Matrix CMS and Funnelback, and partner with CRM and marketing automation leaders SugarCRM and Marketo to create engaging online experiences for our customers. We also provide a broad range of professional services spanning Digital Strategy, UX, Design, Development, Training Hosting, & 24/7 Technical Support. We provide enterprise level solutions to the corporate, government, higher education, not-for-profit and cultural sectors worldwide.

Creative People. Clever Strategies. Brilliant Customer Experiences.

Requirements

With a minimum of 12 months' experience in a Technical Solutions or CRM Consultant capacity, you will have proven confidence with the following:

* Strong conceptual thinking skills, with the ability to create diagrams and visual representations of problems and solutions
* Experience with SugarCRM or equivalent CRM software
* Consulting with clients to ensure requirements, research and priorities are aligned
* Knowledge of web technology, architecture, and SaaS products (PHP, Javascript, XML, JSON, JIRA, Server Configuration)
* Excellent organizational, time management and prioritization skills
* Experience with agile project management, change management
* A fast and pragmatic learner, able to adapt to new products and technology quickly
* Exceptional stakeholder management and client facing experience, with good written and spoken communication skills
* Excellent attention to detail with fluent written and spoken English
* Software engineering, implementation, prototyping and product development
* A Bachelor’s Degree Majoring in Computer Science / Software Engineering / Information Technology or equivalent
* Command line experience, comfortable navigating within a Linux file system, with a good understanding of basic debugging tools

Bonus points for:

* Sales and bid support, cost management and business case generation
* Experience in Java, Perl, Groovy or Python
* Experience with facilitating software development best practices (architecture, development, version control, code reviews)
* Experience working with Higher Education or Government clients

----

* This role is based in our 5th Avenue, New York office - interstate applicants may apply, but relocation costs are currently not being considered
* Applicants must have full working rights (visa sponsorship is currently not being considered)

Benefits

We’re a friendly bunch, and enjoy the unique, relaxed and social environments in all our offices across the globe. We love what we do and we're confident you'll love it too.

What we offer:

* Great culture with open, passionate and friendly colleagues
* 30 days of paid time off + federal holidays
* Health Insurance
* Annual Health and Wellbeing allowance
* Employee Referral Scheme
* Excellent career development opportunities
* Work MacBook and iPhone
* Weekly Thursday Happy Hours


Keen to learn more about us - check out @LifeatSquiz

Squiz is an equal opportunity employer. Every employee has the right to work in surroundings which are free from all forms of unlawful discrimination. It is Squiz's policy that all decisions involving any aspect of the employment relationship will be made without regard to race, color, sex, religion, age, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability, veteran and military status, genetic information, political ideology or any other status or characteristic protected by local, state or federal law. Discrimination and/or harassment based on any of those factors are totally inconsistent with our philosophy of doing business and will not be tolerated.

With regard to applicants or employees with disabilities, Squiz offers reasonable accommodation to enable a person to perform his or her job.

Please note that Squiz does not accept speculative CVs and will not be liable for any introduction fees, or otherwise, should we engage with any candidate speculatively submitted by an agency.

jobs.title: Infrastructure System Administrator
jobs.description:
Our Infrastructure team is looking for an enthusiastic system administrator with a background in Unix/Linux and macOS system administration and an interest in cloud technologies, devops and networking.

Working as part of the global Infrastructure team, you will assist with the design, implementation and daily operations of Squiz’s critical internal systems and services.

You’ll work in a Linux/macOS based environment managing hardware and software from a variety of vendors, and work as part of a small team while also having many opportunities to operate independently to solve challenges in a 24/7 web environment.

The role

Using your system administration skills, you’ll help build, operate and enhance Squiz’s internal systems and services.

Key responsibilities:

* Manage and support our fleet of Macs
* Manage, support and extend our Jira environment
* Manage, support and extend our GSuite environment
* Maintain and upgrade servers, firewalls, wireless access points and switches as required.
* Perform macOS, Linux and Windows system administration and scripting to improve our ability to manage and automate our internal systems.
* Help to troubleshoot issues across our internal systems and services - hardware, software and networking.
* Help document current and future configuration processes and policies
* Work with internal teams located in the United States, Europe, Australia and New Zealand.
* Provide on-the-ground support at Squiz's Melbourne data centre

Requirements

Mandatory:

* Excellent team communications, particularly with remote team members
* Positive attitude and strong work ethic
* A keen interest in learning about SaaS applications, web hosting, networks and servers
* Ability to work proactively with minimal supervision
* Located in Melbourne
* Willing to go on-call and work out of hours as required
* Willing to undergo a government security clearance, if required

Highly Desirable:

* Ability to write clear and thorough documentation
* Experience working and managing SaaS and On-Prem systems such as Jira and GSuite
* 1-2 Years experience working with Linux servers or equivalent study
* 2+ Years experience with managing a fleet of Macs or equivalent study
* Can demonstrate scripting or development experience (e.g. Bash, Python, PHP)

Benefits

What’s in it for you?

* Wellness program - $300 per year to spend on your own well-being
* 30 days of paid leave/year
* Flexible working hours
* Generously stocked kitchen (and fridge!)
* Access to local and international job opportunities across all our offices
* Regular office drinks, social events, gaming nights and ping pong

If this sounds like you, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you’d be a great fit for this role in your cover letter! And if you’ve got some work you’re particularly proud of, we’d love to see that too!

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We’re seeking an experienced and passionate Full Stack Frontend Developer to join our team of ~10 locally and ~400 globally. We’ve got an amazing 20-year story with 13 offices around the world and an exciting future ahead.

You will be part of the newly formed Squiz Matrix Experience team, which will see you:

  • Help build out our Marketplace library (https://dxp.squiz.net/marketplace (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fdxp.squiz.net%2Fmarketplace) ) with new components and templates, enabling our users to quickly build digital experiences;
  • Develop the new UI and page builder feature for Matrix 6, the largest and most important release to date;
  • Design and develop new ways of building and using site, page, and component-based web templates; and
  • Continuously improve the core product by developing new features and enhancements as driven by the Roadmap and customer feedback.

Requirements

We'd love to hear from you if you have:

  • Lives and breathes frontend web technologies and languages such as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS;
  • Has commercial experience with modern JavaScript frameworks such as Vue and React;
  • Has knowledge of software development processes and tools like version control (Git), Agile, TDD, and CI/CD;
  • Has experience working with task runners and workflow management tools such as Gulp, Webpack, and NPM scripts;
  • Has a passion for clean code and reducing technical debt

Bonus points for:

  • Commercial experience working with CMS platforms such as Squiz Matrix, Wordpress, Drupal, Joomla, or others;
  • Experience designing and building great UI/UX interfaces; and
  • Passion for making the web accessible and a practical understanding of standards like WCAG and ARIA

Benefits

Why join us?

You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down-to-earth people you’ll ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate individuals who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is that we work hard but have a lot of fun doing it.

Every Squiz employee enjoys a range of workplace benefits such as a generously stocked kitchen, healthy lifestyle allowance and an innovative leave scheme allowing you to manage your 30 days leave in a way that suits you.

If this sounds like you, tell us why this role should be yours!

jobs.title: Marketing Automation Consultant
jobs.description:
The Role

Squiz have a number of clients who use Marketo and are looking for an experienced consultant to lead this capability in the UK region. You will feel comfortable working closely with our clients to ensure they get the most value out of their Marketo instances. You will then have the opportunity to work with the wider team to leverage Squiz’s wider DXP offering with current and prospective clients.

This is a great opportunity for someone with client facing experience or someone who has worked internally in the past and is looking for the next step to client consulting. As a Squiz Marketing Automation Consultant you will: help clients to implement digital solutions in a wide range of industries, build strong relationships with clients and project teams, and be involved in all areas of consulting and project delivery lifecycle, from sales to implementation to ongoing support and enhancement.

Responsibilities:

* Understand and unpick client requirements and translate this to best practise MA implementation.
* Advise clients on the pros and cons of multiple approaches enabling them to make an informed decision.
* Configuration of client Marketo instances that are aligned with their business objectives.
* Support clients delivering marketing campaigns through Marketo.
* Work with internal marketing teams for best practise on Squiz’s own implementation.
* Measure and demonstrate the value delivered to clients.
* Plan and execute client Marketing Automation roadmaps and strategies.
* Where required, work onsite with clients to build strong relationships across the business and upskill clients to self-sufficiently own their instance.
* Advise on relevant and personalised solutions based on your knowledge and experience, often when put on the spot.

Requirements

* Minimum 3 years Marketing experience.
* Minimum 2 years experience in Marketing Automation tools at a technical level.
* Experience with Marketo (MCE, MCSA or equivalent would be a plus).
* Experience leading client workshops to: gather client requirements; measure success; conduct user training; etc.
* Ideally you will have had exposure to HTML and CSS.
* A logical approach to problem solving/analytical skills.
* Good organisational skills to manage and prioritise workloads.
* A proactive and strategic thinker who is able to quickly and effectively solve problems.
* Ability to communicate technical information to non-IT clients and colleagues.

Whilst we are looking for someone experienced in Marketo, the essential criteria we are looking for is an eagerness to learn. This is a role you can truly make your own with plenty of room to grow - you will work closely with our Consulting team to develop your skills as a leading marketing consultant. We are looking for someone with the potential to create and drive our clients MA strategy and we will work closely with you to enable you to do so.

Benefits

We believe in growing talent and encourage our team to take on more responsibility to develop their career with us. We’re a friendly bunch, and enjoy the unique, relaxed and social environments in all our offices across the globe. We love what we do and we're confident you'll love it too...

jobs.title: Finance Manager
jobs.description:
We have ambitious growth aspirations and our success in achieving those goals comes from making smart commercial decisions based on informed financial and other data.

As our UK Finance Manager, you will be a trusted business partner to our UK management team and key member of our group finance team. You will apply your financial and commercial acumen to contribute to key business decisions that go to supporting and investing in our growth.

Reporting directly into our Chief Financial Officer, there is plenty of growth opportunity both within the role and beyond. You will also be adept at providing day to day management and direction by working closely with our Finance Assistant.

Requirements

Aside from the usual responsibilities expected as a Finance Manager, you will also:

* Use your commercial skills and data to inform and support decision making
* Prepare management and statutory reporting with strong analysis
* Manage customer contractual matters with help from Group Counsel where required
* Manage compliance matters, including acting as the key audit liaison for the UK


You will also be someone who:

* Has strong attention to detail who can correlate data from various sources and determine the outcomes
* Is practical and identifies and implements solutions rather than share theories, and you get stuff done
* Works efficiently, effectively and autonomously, but is equally happy participating and contributing to teams
* Has experience working with various software packages (ideally including Sage and Xero)
* Advanced excel skills, v-lookups won’t be enough
* Has experience of migrating finance systems and SQL database queries


Squiz delivers amazing customer experiences with CMS, CRM, Marketing Automation, and Search and Innovation technology. We provide enterprise level solutions to the corporate, government, educational, not for profit and cultural sectors worldwide. Our goal is to empower our customers by providing the platform, tools and confidence needed to thrive in a digital first world.

With over 450 employees in offices all over the globe, including Poland, UK, USA, Australia and NZ, we work with the best people to bring systems, people and experiences together to deliver a consistent customer experience across multiple channels. Our greatest assets are the people we interact with and we create a fun, flexible, supportive and progressive work environment to ensure all our employees and clients have the best possible experience.

Creative People. Clever Strategies. Brilliant Customer Experiences.

Benefits

We believe in growing talent and encourage our team to take on more responsibility to develop their career with us. We’re a friendly bunch, and enjoy the unique, relaxed and social environments in all our offices across the globe. We love what we do and we're confident you'll love it too...

* Flexible Working Hours
* 30 days annual leave + bank holidays
* Annual Season Ticket Loan
* Annual Health and Wellbeing allowance
* Cycle to Work Scheme
* Employee Referral Scheme
* Excellent career development opportunities
* Macbook
* Great WeWork office space at Old Street roundabout
* Friday office stand-up, travel opportunities to other office locations, friendly and social team environment


Keen to learn more about us? Check out @LifeatSquiz

Please note that Squiz does not accept speculative CVs and will not be liable for any introduction fees, or otherwise, should we engage with any candidate speculatively submitted by an agency.

If you have the drive and motivation to succeed, we’d love to hear from you. Please provide a brief cover letter together with your CV.

jobs.title: Learning Experience Consultant (E-Learning Consultant)
jobs.description:
Our success in this highly competitive environment is ensuring that we cultivate great learning for our people and our customers so they can give their best every day. This role will suit someone who has instructional design experience and a true passion for the future of learning.

The opportunity to make a large and lasting impact is real. As a Learning Experience Consultant you will be supporting the overarching learning for our people and customers ensuring it is a seamless and customer-centric experience. As a creative instructional designer, you will be partnering across the business bringing to life "digital-first" principles to shape Product learning solutions that really add value to Squiz and our customers.

Requirements

Key activities will include:

* Partnering with the product and marketing teams to develop, deploy and maintain high quality learning experiences on our Products for our people and our customers
* Understanding the customer (Internal and external) and ensuring our solutions cultivate their continuous learning
* Managing, maintaining and supporting our learning platforms including our learning systems and intranet and internet pages
* Administration of the learning experience process for our people and our customers as needed, and identifying new ways of working and automation opportunities
* Leading stakeholders through the learning design, development and deployment process
* Facilitating learning design workshops with stakeholders

About you:

* Loves translating tech speak into learning that makes sense to the end user
* A lifelong learner and a great communicator
* Someone who rolls up their sleeves and helps others to ensure team success
* Is outcome focussed and gets what they need done
* Innovative and creative and takes pride in the work they produce, ensuring quality and continuous improvement
* Demonstrates resilience and good humour when the going gets tough

And to set you apart:

* Excellent at facilitating workshops with stakeholders
* Adept at using popular E-learning authoring and video editing tools
* Comfortable using learning systems and platforms

* Experience in a similar role within an E-learning consulting firm or tech company

Benefits

You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down-to-earth people you’ll ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate people who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we work hard and have a lot of fun doing it.

Every Squiz employee enjoys a range of workplace benefits such as a generously stocked kitchen, games areas, a healthy lifestyle allowance and an innovative leave scheme allowing you to manage your 30 day leave in a way that suits you.

If this sounds like you, tell us why this role should be yours. Shortlisted applicants will be provided with a MyInterview link to answer a few initial questions via video; creativity is always welcome!

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
As Squiz’s Product Marketing Manager, you will be accountable for delivering clear messaging and positioning for our Gartner rated products and Digital Experience platform.

You understand our products inside and out and know our buyers intimately including what problems they are trying to solve and how they make their buying decisions. You’re skilled in leveraging insights to drive the development of positioning and messaging that resonates with buyers and empowers our sales channels to be successful.

You will collaborate with your peers in Acquisition Marketing to develop innovative programs that drive demand. In addition to the marketing team, you will regularly collaborate with product managers and sales channels.

Your ability to grasp and present our product’s value proposition in a way that resonates and clearly articulates how we solve our buyers’ problem is critical to your success.

We build products that are used by high profile organisations in government, finance, higher education sectors, just to mention a few.

Requirements

You will:

* Develop compelling, engaging and differentiated product positioning and messaging for each of the Squiz product offerings to inform the creation of collateral, web content, sales tools etc.
* Ensure all product positioning and messaging resonates with our target buyer personas and clearly address problems to solve and articulates our point of difference
* Work with designers to ensure you are creating high impact collateral that reflects the company brand
* Be an expert on our competition, what products do they sell and how they are positioned
* Work with product management to understand key features and benefits for each product in our portfolio and understand how each product works together to deliver an integrated Digital Experience Platform
* Assess the effectiveness of the marketing programs that support your products on an ongoing basis, and influence required changes
* Plan the launches of new products and releases of existing products, and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan
* Work with the Sales team and Sales Enablement Manager to ensure sales are equipped to sell

You Bring

* 2+ years of experience in a similar role as a Product Marketing Manager within a B2B technology company
* Excellent writing skills for authoring compelling content and product messaging, with examples of user-centred written communications
* Experience with developing and executing product launch strategies and tactics
* Familiar with demand generation marketing tactics
* Experience using web and search analytics tools

Benefits

And who are we?

Squiz is both a technology company and digital agency. We’re all about making technology do even greater things and create engaging and compelling digital experiences for our customers. We’ve got an amazing 20 year story with 13 offices around the world and an exciting future ahead.

Why work for Squiz?

You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down-to-earth people you’ll ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate people who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we work hard but have a lot of fun doing it.

Every Squiz employee enjoys a range of workplace benefits such a healthy lifestyle allowance and an innovative leave scheme allowing you up to 30 days paid leave per year.

If this sounds like you, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you’d be a great fit for this role in your cover letter! And if you’ve got some work you’re particularly proud of, we’d love to see that too!

jobs.title: Senior Account Manager
jobs.description:
Squiz is leading the Digital Experience Revolution. We are partners with some of Australia's most influential organisations and are trusted to anchor their digital transformations.

We're currently looking for a sales-oriented Senior Account Manager to join our sales team in Canberra.

You are someone who is able to build trusted customer relationships and are seen as a true business partner - your clients know you get them, since you listen and know you partner with them to find great digital solutions. You also thrive in finding new opportunities to align Squiz capabilities and products with client needs.

In this role you will find the freedom to learn but also a tribe of people willing to help. The Squiz Sales Academy will ensure that you continue to grow and support your success. A personal passion to achieve and grow will set you apart and will see you rewarded with further opportunities within Squiz.

What you'll do:

* Find opportunities to diversify the solutions and services provided within your client base
* Map customer challenges to Squiz solutions and services
* Develop competitive proposals and tender responses with the support of our production team
* Create and manage account plans to ensure you have intimate knowledge of each client, their future plans, structure, procurement processes and so on, to help drive growth in your accounts

Requirements

We'd love to hear from you if you have...

* Understanding of the ‘business of IT’ within the enterprise
* Strong experience working in the B2B technology space
* Experience working within the enterprise or software development or Internet industries
* Working knowledge of software development practices or IT operations practices highly desired
* Experience in CMS or Search
* Experience working directly with senior representatives from enterprise customers


Ideally you are tech savvy. You won’t be required to code or develop the technical solutions - you’ll work alongside an amazing technical team for that - but knowledge will help you, as often you will “translate” the technical to your clients. Experience in digital will be highly regarded.

Benefits

What's in it for you?

* Working alongside some of the most intelligent and down-to-earth people
* Wellness program - $300 per year to spend on your own well-being
* An innovative approach to 30 days of paid leave/year
* Flexible working options
* Squiz Academy - includes professional sales coaching from industry experts
* Access to local and international job opportunities across all our offices
* Agency environment - regular office drinks, social events, gaming nights, pool, ping pong to name a few


If this sounds like you, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you’d be a great fit for this role.

  • Working alongside some of the most intelligent and down-to-earth people
  • Wellness program - $300 per year to spend on your own well-being
  • An innovative approach to 30 days of paid leave/year
  • Flexible working options
  • Squiz Academy - includes professional sales coaching from industry experts
  • Access to local and international job opportunities across all our offices
  • Agency environment - regular office drinks, social events, gaming nights, pool, ping pong to name a few

If this sounds like you, even if you don’t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you’d be a great fit for this role.

jobs.title: Senior Pricing Manager
jobs.description:
Squiz is on an ambitious growth path and our success comes from ensuring we are leading in the market.

As our Pricing Manager, you will be an integral player in this by developing a compelling vision and implementing effective competitive software and services pricing strategies. You will provide strategic pricing leadership and capability across our market leading products and services. Your goal will be to improve our recurring product revenue and maintain consistent margins to improve EBIT and drive sustained profit growth.

Reporting directly to our Chief Product Officer, there is plenty of opportunity to grow and have an impact on our success.

Requirements

You bring:

* Proven track record of 5+years in building and leading a value based pricing strategy function in a B2B software company.
* International and commercial pricing experience. You have delivered high impact pricing / promotions strategies, price optimisation projects, execution, analysis or consultancy.
* Excellent price modelling and data skills.
* A proven mix of strategic capability and operational execution. The ability to set the direction and also roll up your sleeves to build out the necessary tools and materials .
* A seasoned manager with strong end to end pricing knowledge who can get a new pricing capability up and running quickly.
* Discipline in pricing and revenue management and operations that drives bottom line growth.

And also you are:

* A team player focused on being a coach and mentor to build best practises pricing culture.
* A confident and influential person with excellent communication skills; and a track record influencing strategy with senior leadership teams (C suite) and product teams.
* Tertiary qualified (preferably in Economics, Business, Mathematics, Engineering, Marketing or finance) is preferred.

Benefits

And who are we?

Squiz is both a technology company and digital agency. We’re all about making technology do even greater things and create engaging and compelling digital experiences for our customers. We’ve got an amazing 20 year story with 13 offices around the world and an exciting future ahead.

We build a product that’s used by high profile organisations in government, finance, higher education sectors, just to mention a few.

Why work for Squiz?

You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down-to-earth people you’ll ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate people who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we work hard and have a lot of fun doing it.

Every Squiz employee enjoys a range of workplace benefits such as a healthy lifestyle allowance and an innovative leave scheme allowing you up to 30 days paid leave per year.

jobs.title: Service Delivery Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As Service Delivery Manager you will work closely with our production team to manage the operational delivery of services to our clients (in South Australia and Western Australia) and also act as the key point of contact for any client escalation queries.

You will play an integral part in delivering service management, incident and change management, continual service improvement and customer satisfaction. You are also a fantastic people person with the ability to foster strong relationships between different stakeholders.

Requirements

Your role will involve:

  • Building and fostering lasting relationships with our clients;
  • Ensuring successful service delivery by meeting SLA targets;
  • Communicating effectively to resolve issues and develop new opportunities;
  • Anticipating and responding to client needs proactively to ensure a high level of client satisfaction;
  • Monitoring the overall performance of services;
  • Generating service delivery reports and run service delivery meetings;
  • Providing change management reports to guide the operations team and ensure preparation for changes;
  • Working with the production operations team to create and manage scheduled upgrades and the necessary reports;
  • Acting as the regional support contact to develop common procedures and processes to manage the ticketing system
  • Communicating effectively across stakeholders ranging from Production team staff to senior management and clients;
  • Monitoring the overall performance of services by collaborating with Regional and Business Managers on resource allocation and task delegation;
  • Maintaining all client-related records, documentation and portfolios.
  • Occasional travel to Perth (once per quarter) may be required

You will bring

  • Technical understanding of the web space, including web development, server level technology, integration techniques, ITIL or similar formal support model understanding/expertise
  • Experience within a vendor environment, managing client and internal support ticketing;
  • Experience in negotiation, management and risk management for operational support;
  • Experience with JIRA, or similar desirable;
  • A people orientated personality which enjoys fostering relationships;
  • An ability to drive processes to achieve targets;
  • Adaptability and a love for fast-paced environments;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
